summary: This is an email from the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), notifying them that OPR's draft report on the USAO-SDFL's 2006-2008 handling of the Epstein matter will be transmitted to U.S. Attorney Strauss for review and comment. It highlights an internal DOJ review of the prior prosecution.

persons.name: Strauss
persons.context: The recipient of the OPR draft report on the Epstein matter, to be provided for review and comment by her office.

persons.name: Counsel
persons.context: The sender of the email from the DOJ's OPR, informing the recipient about the forthcoming draft report.

connections.description: OPR Counsel is notifying the recipient that the draft report will be transmitted to U.S. Attorney Strauss for review.

events.title: USAO-SDFL's handling of Epstein matter
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case, which is the subject of an OPR review.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Transmission Notification
events.description: The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility notifies the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York that its draft report on the prior Epstein case handling will be sent to U.S. Attorney Strauss.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted a review of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida's handling of the Epstein matter from 2006-2008.
OPR's draft report on this review was being transmitted to U.S. Attorney Strauss for comment in August 2020.
The email instructs that the draft report be 'closely held,' indicating its sensitive nature.
The communication shows ongoing internal DOJ scrutiny of the prior Epstein prosecution years after the case.
